Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
Concrete implementation of the Board interface.

This class manages the game board state, including the board matrix, current falling piece, piece generation, rotation, and row clearing. It uses a RandomBrickGenerator for fair piece distribution and a BrickRotator for handling piece rotations.

The board is represented as a 2D integer array where:

  • 0 represents an empty cell
  • 1-7 represent different colored locked blocks

The board includes hidden rows at the top (rows 0-1) to allow pieces to spawn above the visible area.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Rajul Kabir
See Also:

  • BrickRotator

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleBoard

      public SimpleBoard(int width, int height)
      Creates a new SimpleBoard with the specified dimensions.

      Initializes the board with an empty matrix, creates a new RandomBrickGenerator for piece generation, and initializes the score system.

      Parameters:
      width - The width of the board in cells
      height - The height of the board in cells (including hidden rows)

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Creates a new piece at the top of the board.

      This method generates a new piece from the brick generator and places it at the default starting position. If the piece immediately collides with existing blocks, the game is over.

      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new piece collides immediately (game over), false otherwise

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Gets the current game board matrix.

      The matrix represents the state of all locked blocks on the board. Each cell contains either 0 (empty) or a color code (1-7) representing a locked block.

      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      A 2D array representing the game board state

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Gets the view data for the current falling piece.

      This includes the piece's shape, position, and the next piece preview.

      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      ViewData containing the current piece information

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Merges the current falling piece into the board background.

      This method is called when a piece can no longer move down. The piece becomes part of the locked board state.

      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Clears any completed rows and returns information about the clear operation.

      This method checks for fully filled rows, removes them, shifts remaining blocks down, and calculates the score bonus.

      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      ClearRow object containing information about cleared rows and score bonus

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Resets the board to start a new game.

      This clears the board matrix, resets the score, and creates a new starting piece.

      Specified by:
      newGame in interface Board

    • setBrick

      public boolean setBrick(Brick brick, int rotation)
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Sets a specific brick as the current piece with a given rotation.

      This method is primarily used for the hold/swap functionality, allowing a previously held piece to be placed on the board.

      Specified by:
      setBrick in interface Board
      Parameters:
      brick - The brick to set as the current piece
      rotation - The rotation state (0-3) for the brick
      Returns:
      true if the brick collides immediately at the starting position, false otherwise

    • getCurrentBrick

      public Brick getCurrentBrick()
      Gets the current brick that is falling.

      This method is used by the hold system to retrieve the current piece before swapping it with a held piece.

      Returns:
      The current Brick object

    • getCurrentRotation

      public int getCurrentRotation()
      Gets the current rotation state of the falling piece.

      This method is used by the hold system to preserve the rotation state when swapping pieces.

      Returns:
      The current rotation index (0-3)
